bug.author: anguoyang
bug.summary: Using single GPU when training on object detection
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Lightning using only one GPU training, it happens only on object detection applications, it seems lightning does not support target to be a tuple of tensors in the data loader. 1.if we use pytorch with object detection, it is fine 2.if we use pytorch-lightning with classification tasks, e.g. face recognition, it is also fine 3.if we use pytorch-lightning with object detection, it uses only 1 GPU even if we set 4 GPUs for it <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: there is an example on pytorch-lightning with object detection: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Erlemar/wheat>https://github.com/Erlemar/wheat</denchmark-link>
you could reproduce the problem by modify the ngpu=4 or any value>1 then see the GPU usage with nvidia-smi. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Using all GPUs when training <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
1.conda python3.7 virtual envs 2.Ubuntu 18.04 3.Cuda version: 10.1 4.pytorch version: 1.5.1 5.lightning version: we tried on several versions, from version 0.7.6 ~ the master version on June.24

comments.comment: I see a config file in wheat/conf/trainer/default_trainer.yaml which has gpus=1 Try to change that?

AFAIK, the param of could be one of , or . You set your param so it will only use one GPU. Try to change to to use all available GPUs as described <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/latest/multi_gpu.html#select-gpu-devices>here</denchmark-link>
Closing this issue. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/anguoyang>@anguoyang</denchmark-link> feel free to reopen if you run into any issues!
